cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles southwest of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward southeast Louisiana and the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast – between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Pearl River (near Metropolitan New Orleans/Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Cameron, LA to west of Intracoastal City, LA; Tropical Storm Watch from the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans; Storm Surge Warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA to the MS/AL border including Vermilion Bay, Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Louisiana, Mississippi coast, and portions of coastal Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Major hurricane winds possible; sustained winds 74–110 mph with higher gusts likely Sunday, especially as the eye comes ashore near Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 7–11 ft possible at and east of the Mississippi River Delta, including Plaquemines Port District.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with locally 20 inches possible, producing considerable flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas, dangerous rip currents, large breaking waves along river entrances; possible tornadoes in rain bands Sunday into Monday.
